text_1_claim_summary: SolarWhale’s core revenue engine is proprietary floating-PV platforms for sunny, water-rich regions.
text_1_evidence: Over 70 % of FY24 sales came from the Nimbus™ floating-panel line deployed on reservoirs in Southeast Asia.
Patents cover the company’s hydro-cooling ballast system, extending panel life by 15 %.
text_2_claim_summary: WindFox relies on modular mid-altitude turbines designed for inland wind belts.
text_2_evidence: WindFox sells 3 MW Zephyr™ turbines optimized for class III wind sites, representing 65 % of its installed base.
The firm owns no floating-PV IP and regards solar as an ‘adjacent experiment’ in its 2030 plan.

text_1_claim_summary: SolarWhale is asset-light, outsourcing EPC work and recycling capex into R&D.
text_1_evidence: The company sub-contracts engineering to AquaGrid and spends 9 % of revenue on internal labs.
Capex averaged 2 % of sales in the last three years.
text_2_claim_summary: WindFox vertically integrates EPC, driving higher upfront capex but capturing O&M margin.
text_2_evidence: WindFox owns two blade-casting plants and a 180-truck logistics fleet.
Capex averaged 11 % of sales from 2022-24; O&M gross margin is 32 % versus 19 % for peers.

text_1_claim_summary: Both firms pursue emerging-market growth, but SolarWhale targets water-scarce power reservoirs while WindFox targets land-constrained agrarian plains.
text_1_evidence: 70 % of SolarWhale’s backlog is in countries with <1,500 m³ per-capita freshwater availability.
CEO quote: ‘If there’s a dam and sunshine, we can monetise the surface.’
text_2_claim_summary: WindFox focuses on windy grain belts where turbine foundations double as grain-drying silos.
text_2_evidence: WindFox has signed MOUs with the Prairie Food Co-op to co-locate 400 turbines on corn fields.
Marketing deck: ‘Our pylons create shade that reduces soil evaporation by 6 %—a selling point for farmers.’

text_1_claim_summary: SolarWhale’s balance sheet is conservatively levered with a net-cash position and BBB+ rating.
text_1_evidence: Moody’s upgrade report (Apr 2025) cites “predictable PPAs and modest leverage.”
text_2_claim_summary: WindFox carries higher leverage after bond-financed plant expansions, prompting a BB+ rating outlook.
text_2_evidence: S&P placed WindFox on ‘negative outlook’ citing refinancing risk in 2027.

text_1_claim_summary: Both companies claim strong ESG credentials, yet SolarWhale already reports third-party-verified Scope 3 data while WindFox plans to do so by 2026.
text_1_evidence: FY24 report includes TÜV-certified upstream emissions for aluminum frames.
SolarWhale won the 2024 BluePlanet award for transparent life-cycle accounting.
text_2_claim_summary: WindFox’s ESG roadmap sets a 2026 target for Scope 3 disclosure and is still gathering supplier inventories.
text_2_evidence: 2024 CSR: ‘Scope 3 inventory under development; full disclosure by FY26.’
Only Scope 1+2 emissions were assured by EcoAudit in 2024.
